meanings.definition: Free from an obligation or liability imposed on others.
meanings.sent1: The student was exempt from taking the final exam due to his high grades.
meanings.sent2: She was exempt from jury duty because she was a full-time caregiver.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think it was exempt from following the rules of the house.
meanings.sent4: The rare flower stood out, exempt from the common pests that plagued the garden.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape billowed behind him, exempt from the laws of gravity.

meanings.definition: To excuse or release from a duty or requirement.
meanings.sent1: The doctor exempted her from strenuous exercise after the surgery.
meanings.sent2: He exempted his brother from doing the dishes as a birthday gift.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to exempt himself from cleaning up after the party.
meanings.sent4: The wise king exempted the young prince from attending the boring council meetings.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand seemed to exempt him from the laws of nature as he performed his tricks.
